result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy C Beck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
No credit if revoked from probation.
Concurrent with: any sentence currently serving.

miscConds.notes: PAY THROUGH DEPT. OF CORRECTIONS, ANY BOND POSTED MAY BE APPLIED.
PAY THROUGH DEPT. OF CORRECTIONS, ANY BOND POSTED MAY BE APPLIED.   Start making payments by 7/1/22 if possible.  May take money from canteen fund up to statutory amount allowed.
Follow recommendations of Probation Agent.  Submit a DNA sample by 7/1/22.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Timothy C Beck
Current: Green Bay Correctional Institution, P.O. Box 19033, Green Bay, WI 54307 United States  (Effective: 05-24-2022)
Prior: 615 Stokke Parkway, Menomonie, WI 54751
for Plea being held in Br 1

9:14 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy C Beck appeared by video from GB Correctional.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen in court for Timothy C Beck. V. Girard - Clerk 
22CF11, 21CF294
Atty Lundeen - he was in Dodge & then transferred to Green Bay so have not spoke with him - have another case in Br 2
Deft - wants to get this done today - sent Atty Lundeen a letter - waives personal appearance
Attu Lundeen - would resolve both cases today - free to argue jail
State - victim did not request notification so believe we could proceed - plea to Ct 1 21CF294 as repeater & Ct 1 22CF11 Crim Dmg as repeater - dismiss other cts - 
  in 21CF294 w/h sent 3 yrs prob, recommends 9 mo jail, restitution $5018.62 includes 10%,$548 CC  in 22CF11 w/h sent 1 yr pob, costs $473 & rest $1,574.77
Recess taken for break out room
9:28 am back on the record with same parties present
Atty Lundeen - ready to proceed
Deft - in 21CF294 enters a plea of Guilty to Ct 1 with repeater, in 22CF11 enters a plea of Guilty to Ct 1 with repeater, waives rights & JT
Parties stip that facts support the plea - not asking for PSI
Parties make arguments State reads VIS
Atty Lundeen - asks for no conditional jail - has already sat on this case & is in prison on another matter - release date depended on getting these cases resolved & get into programming
Deft - currently sitting 4 in & 4 out - speaks on own behalf

Court - finds waivers & pleas made knowingly & voluntarily, finds factual basis & approves stip by parties 

  in 21CF294 Accepts plea to Ct 1 & finds deft guilty of charge
  Orders:
  w/h sent 3 yrs prob, restitution $5018.62 includes 10%-start making payments by 7/1/22 if possible - may take $ from canteen fund up to stat. amt ,$528 CC, follow recommendations of PO, may not poss any firearms, submit a DNA sample by 7/1/22 - orders 7 mo jail time concurrent with current sent. - huber for any purpose prison allows
 
  in 22CF11  Accepts plea to Ct 1 & finds deft guilty of charge
  Orders:
  w/h sent 1 yr pob, costs $453 & rest $1,574.77 includes 10% start making payments by 7/1/22 if possible - may take $ from canteen fund up to stat. amt , follow recommendations of PO, submit a DNA sample by 7/1/22

Both cases concurrent with current sentence - jail would be concurrent also
Dismiss & Read in- Cts 2 - 4 in 21CF294 & Ct 2 in 22CF11

Atty Lundeen to submit jail credit

10:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy C Beck not in court.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen in court for Timothy C Beck. A. Standaert - Clerk 

Atty Lundeen - notes that deft is in Dodge, asks for new return date
State - agrees
Court - so schedules
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:16 AM - Defendant, Timothy C Beck appear by video from the Dunn County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly.  Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appears by Zoom.  A. Standaert - Clerk
Atty Tomtschik - rec'd criminal complaint, waives reading, waives speedy prelim
Court - schedules return date

10:44 AM Defendant, Timothy C Beck failed to appear.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly.  Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appears by Zoom.  A. Standaert - Clerk
State - asks for warrant
Court - issues warrant
Served Timothy Beck with Summons and Criminal Complaint
Initial appearance on January 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
